      • createAABB

        public static final Rectangle createAABB(Vec2f[] points)

      • circleContainsPoint

        public static final boolean circleContainsPoint(float centerX,
                                                float centerY,
                                                float radius,
                                                float x,
                                                float y)
        Checks, if the circle defined by the center (centerX, centerY) and the given radius contains the given point (x,y).
        Parameters:
        centerX - The x coordinate of the center of the circle.
        centerY - The y coordinate of the center of the circle.
        radius - The radius of the circle.
        x - The x coordinates of the checked point.
        y - The y coordinates of the checked point.
        Returns:
        True, if the point is contained in the circle (or lays on the border of the circle).

      • rectanglePerimeter

        public static final float rectanglePerimeter(float width,
                                             float height)
        Calculates the perimeter of the rectangle with the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the rectangle (distance from lower left to lower right corner).
        height - Height of the rectangle (distance from the lower left to the upper left corner).
        Returns:
        The perimeter of the rectangle in the unit of the given width and height.

      • aabbContainsPoint

        public static final boolean aabbContainsPoint(float x,
                                              float y,
                                              float w,
                                              float h,
                                              float pointX,
                                              float pointY)
        Checks, if the by x,y, width and height defined AABB contains the given point (pointX, pointY)
        Parameters:
        x - Lower left corner x coordinate
        y - Lower left corner y coordinate
        w - width of the aabb
        h - height of the aabb
        pointX - x Coordinate of the checked point
        pointY - y Coordinate of the checked point
        Returns:
        True, if the point is located inside the rectangle shape (Also true is the point lays on the border of the rectangle).

      • polygonArea

        public static final float polygonArea(float[] polygon)
        Sames as polygonArea(polygon, polygon.length)

      • polygonArea

        public static final float polygonArea(float[] polygon,
                                      int length)
        http://alienryderflex.com/polygon_area/ if the parameters don't match the requirements or an error in the caluclation happens the error code -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        polygon - 2 values of the array will be used as 1 vertice with the x coordinate followed by the y coordinate. The length of the polygon has to be just and greater equal 6.
        length - Marks the end of points in the given array that will be used to calculate the array. Therefore the value of length has to be in the interval [6,polygon.length]. Also length % 2 has to be zero.

      • isValidPolygon

        public static final boolean isValidPolygon(float[] polygon)
        Checks, if the given array of floats can be interpreted as a polygon of 2d vertices.
        Parameters:
        polygon - The array, that is checked.
        Returns:
        True, if the array can be interpreted as an 2D polygon.

      • polygonPerimeter

        public static final float polygonPerimeter(float[] polygon)
        Same as polygonPerimeter(polygon, polygon.length)

      • polygonPerimeter

        public static final float polygonPerimeter(float[] polygon,
                                           int length)
        if the parameters don't match the requirements or an error in the calculation happens the error code -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        polygon - 2 values of the array will be used as 1 vertex with the x coordinate followed by the y coordinate. The length of the polygon has to be just and greater equal 6.
        length - Marks the end of points in the given array that will be used to calculate the perimeter. Therefore the value of length has to be in the interval [6,polygon.length]. Also length % 2 has to be an even number.
